docs.abstract: A medical researcher’s new book links a rise in diseases and other ailments to the changing composition of microbes in the gut, primarily blaming antibiotics for the connection.
docs.snippet: A medical researcher’s new book links a rise in diseases and other ailments to the changing composition of microbes in the gut, primarily blaming antibiotics for the connection.

docs.lead_paragraph: A comprehensive review of earlier studies found higher levels of antioxidants and lower levels of pesticides in organic fruits and vegetables compared with conventionally grown produce.

headline.main: Study of Organic Crops Finds Fewer Pesticides and More Antioxidants
headline.print_headline: Study of Organic Crops Finds Fewer Pesticides and More Antioxidants

docs.abstract: Comprehensive review of earlier studies to be published in British Journal of Nutrition finds substantially higher levels of antioxidants and lower levels of pesticides in organic fruits, vegetables and grains compared with conventionally grown produce; findings stop short of claiming that eating organic produce will lead to better health.
docs.snippet: A comprehensive review of earlier studies found higher levels of antioxidants and lower levels of pesticides in organic fruits and vegetables compared with conventionally grown produce.

docs.lead_paragraph: The apparent cure had raised the thrilling possibility that aggressive early treatment might be able to reverse infections in newborns — and perhaps even in newly infected adults.

headline.main: Evidence of H.I.V. Found in a Child Said to Be Cured
headline.print_headline: Evidence of H.I.V. Found in a Child Said to Be Cured

docs.abstract: National Institutes of Health reports child in Mississippi who was thought to have been cured of HIV with aggressive drug treatment immediately after birth is now showing signs of infection with virus; findings are serious setback to hopes for cure for AIDS; about 2.3 million people worldwide were newly infected with HIV in 2012, with 260,000 infants infected at birth or immediately afterward.
docs.snippet: The apparent cure had raised the thrilling possibility that aggressive early treatment might be able to reverse infections in newborns — and perhaps even in newly infected adults.

docs.lead_paragraph: The most advanced vaccine for dengue only offers modest protection but could still help millions of people avoid the devastating effects of the disease known as "breakbone fever," according to a large trial.

headline.main: Trial: Dengue Shot Offers Some Protection
headline.print_headline: Trial: Dengue Shot Offers Some Protection

docs.snippet: The most advanced vaccine for dengue only offers modest protection but could still help millions of people avoid the devastating effects of the disease known as "breakbone fever," according to a large trial.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ten years ago, Shirley Worthington rushed Tigger to the vet when the dog's mouth started bleeding. When she was told he had cancer, she knew to blame her heavy smoking, an addiction she couldn't kick until after her pet died.

headline.main: Secondhand Smoke as Harmful to Pets as People
headline.print_headline: Secondhand Smoke as Harmful to Pets as People

docs.snippet: Ten years ago, Shirley Worthington rushed Tigger to the vet when the dog's mouth started bleeding. When she was told he had cancer, she knew to blame her heavy smoking, an addiction she couldn't kick until after her pet died.

docs.lead_paragraph: A government scientist cleaning out an old storage room at a research center near Washington made a startling discovery last week — decades-old vials of smallpox packed away and forgotten in a cardboard box.

headline.main: Forgotten Vials of Smallpox Found in Storage Room
headline.print_headline: Forgotten Vials of Smallpox Found in Storage Room

docs.snippet: A government scientist cleaning out an old storage room at a research center near Washington made a startling discovery last week — decades-old vials of smallpox packed away and forgotten in a cardboard box.
